alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 3:19PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Albany and west central Laramie Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 317 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pumpkin Vine, or 19 miles south of Laramie, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laramie, Tie City Campground, North Crow Campground, Vedauwoo, Tie Siding, Pumpkin Vine, Vedauwoo Campground, Yellow Pine Campground and The Buttes. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 317 and 335. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
